required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of the Acute Effect of IP
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-blind, Randomized, Placebo-controlled, Cross-over Study to Assess the Acute Effect of IP on hGH Levels in Aging Adults

brief_summary.textblock: It is a nutraceutical system, consisting of oral tablet and an oral spray called Alpha GPC, which helps your body naturally restore the HGH levels.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in the plasma human growth hormone (hGH) levels in aging individuals
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose: 0 hours and Post dose: 30, 60, 90,120 mins
primary_outcome.description: Change in serum hGH levels from baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Change on Visual Analogue Score for Fatigue
secondary_outcome.description: Change in Visual Analogue Scale score in IP and placebo.

arm_group.description: 2 tablets orally with water and 2 ml of liquid spray to be kept for 30 sec sublingually, before swallowing. To be taken half an hour before dinner prior to the day of site visit.
2 tablets orally with water and 2 ml of liquid spray to be kept for 30 sec sublingually, before swallowing. To be taken half an hour before dinner prior to the day of site visit.

intervention.description: Beige-brown powder with speckles in clear enteric coated caplet with berry flavor liquid.
Beige-brown powder with speckles in clear enteric coated caplet with berry flavor liquid.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Males and females having age between 40-60 years (both inclusive)
- BMI ≥25 and ≤29.9 kg/m2
- FBS ≤ 120 mg/dl
- Serum hGH levels ≤0.94 ng/ml in females and ≤0.12 in males
- Thyroid Stimulating Hormone ≥ 0.35 and ≤ 5.55 mIU/ml
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of thyroid disorder (Hyper/Hypo).
- Smokers having at least 1 cigarette per day.
- Known hypersensitivity or allergy to one or more of the ingredients of the IP
- Participant suffering from primary or secondary insomnia with/without active treatment.
- Alcoholics as defined by consumption of more than 2 standard alcoholic drinks (more than 30 ml/ day) for past 3 months.
